env.name: TZ
env.label: TZ
env.description: Specify a timezone to use for example America/New_York

env.name: APP_KEY
env.label: APP_KEY
env.description:
The encryption key for your sessions. Keep this very secure.
Change it to a string of exactly 32 chars or use something like `php artisan key:generate` to generate it.
If you use Docker or similar, you can set this variable from a file by using APP_KEY_FILE

Avoid the '#' character in your APP_KEY, it may break things.

env.name: DB_HOST
env.label: DB_HOST
env.description: The host of the database server.

env.name: DB_PORT
env.label: DB_PORT
env.description: The port of the database server.

env.name: DB_CONNECTION
env.label: DB_CONNECTION
env.description: The connection type of the database server. (mysql, pgsql, sqlite)

env.name: DB_USERNAME
env.label: DB_USERNAME
env.description: The username of the database user.

env.name: DB_PASSWORD
env.label: DB_PASSWORD
env.description: The password of the database user.

env.name: TRUSTED_PROXIES
env.label: TRUSTED_PROXIES
env.description:
TRUSTED_PROXIES is a useful variable when using Docker and/or a reverse proxy.
Set it to ** and reverse proxies work just fine.

env.name: APP_URL
env.label: APP_URL
env.description: The URL of the application. only used to determine the URL of Firefly III when Firefly III is incapable of doing so: when using the command line or when drafting emails.
